revised_title: Wheatstone's New Instruments and Processes for Determining the Constants of a Voltaic Circuit
tldr: In this article, Charles Wheatstone discusses various instruments and processes he developed to investigate the laws of electric currents and determine the most effective conditions for producing electric effects through extensive circuits. He explains the principles of electro-motive forces and resistances and how they affect the force of the current in a circuit. Wheatstone also introduces the concept of the rheometer, an instrument to measure the force of an electric current, and discusses the distribution of electric currents in circuits with branch conductors.
